intro: Cyrtandra pogonantha, commonly known as the Hawaiian bellflower, is a species of flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and streamside areas. It has opposite, ovate leaves with serrated edges and produces small, fleshy fruits. Cyrtandra pogonantha is an important component of Hawaii's native flora and is often found in protected, lowland habitats.
